description: A broken tribot.  Now that its legs lie broken and immobile, the world seems a little less threatening.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken chicken walker.  Still looks intimidating despite being permanently inoperative, possibly due to the sheer size and mass.  Could be gutted for parts.
A broken tank drone.  Still looks intimidating despite being permanently inoperative, possibly due to the sheer size and mass.  Could be gutted for parts.

This is an inactive Honda Regnal.  Using this item involves placing it on the ground, wondering how it fuels its flamethrower and turning it on.  If reprogrammed and rewired successfully the tribot will then identify you as an ally, roam around or follow you, and impale hostiles with its spiked cable weapons.

use_action.friendly_msg: The tribot rises to its feet and scans the area for contaminants.
use_action.hostile_msg: The tribot glowers down at you and ignites its flamethrower.  Turns out you hate the smell of napalm.
use_action.//: No observed open deployment, likely a prototype or secret project

description: This is an inactive chicken walker.  Using this item involves placing it on the ground, loading the unit with the factory-loaded 5.56 rounds and 40mm cartridge grenades in your inventory (if you wish to divide your ammunition, set aside whatever ammunition you do NOT want to give the robot) and turning it on.  If reprogrammed and rewired successfully the tank drone will then identify you as a friendly, roam around or follow you, and attack all enemies with a built-in firearm and grenade launcher.
//: cheating a bit with the volume due to lack of proper vehicle storage options

use_action.friendly_msg: The chicken bot rolls out and begins acquiring targets.
use_action.hostile_msg: The chicken bot swivels its turret and aims directly at you.  Don your brown pants!
use_action.//: Milspec, clearly designed with little concern for collateral damage.  What did you expect of a chicken walker?
